original_title: Country advances national park system, enhancing ecological conservation
article_summary: China has made significant progress in its national park system, with improvements in ecosystem diversity, stability, and sustainability. Key achievements include the success of the Giant Panda National Park in connecting wild giant panda habitats, the increase in Amur tiger and leopard populations in the Northeast China Tiger and Leopard National Park, and the continuous growth of the Hainan gibbon population in the Hainan Tropical Rainforest National Park. The national park system also provides opportunities for local communities, with nearly 50,000 residents working as ecological guardians. The World Wide Fund for Nature has praised China's initiative, highlighting its role in advancing global environmental goals and demonstrating the compatibility of conservation and sustainable development.</s>
